text: Bob Lymburne (born 30 July 1909, date of death unknown) was a Canadian ski jumper. ==Career== He competed in the individual event at the 1932 Winter Olympics. In 1935, he suffered a severe head injury while ski jumping. At some point after 1957, he wandered into the woods and was not seen again. ==Ski jumping world records== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:left; line-height:16px; width:33%;" !style="background-color: #ccc;" width="120"|Date !style="background-color: #ccc;" width="100"|Hill !style="background-color: #ccc;" width="155"|Location !style="background- color: #ccc;" width="48"|Metres !style="background-color: #ccc;" width="48"|Feet |-bgcolor=#FAEBD7 | align=right|12 March 1932 | Nels Nelsen Hill | Revelstoke, Canada | align=center|82 | align=center|269 |- | align=right|March 1933 | Nels Nelsen Hill | Revelstoke, Canada | align=center|87.5 | align=center|287 |} Not recognized. Stood at world record distance at unofficial competition. Amateur WR. ==See also== * List of people who disappeared mysteriously: pre-1970 ==References== Category:1909 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Canadian male ski jumpers Category:Olympic ski jumpers of Canada Category:Ski jumpers at the 1932 Winter Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Thunder Bay
title: Bob Lymburne
